column5: We were suprised to come across morel mushrooms today here on our place in the Dryden area. Found a around 3 dozen which we ate with walleye and drowned with some red wine. What a treat. Anybody know if these are common place? The neighbors did not seem to know anything about them.
I have been finding them for years around Minaki.

[font color=green size=3][b]Morels do exist in NWO but often times you see a much commoner larger mushroom (fist sized)that looks like a morel but can be lethal. Some times you can eat these large mushrooms without any problem, but they can produce a compound that is lethal and there is no remedy for. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby

Yes, I read up on the false Morel just to make sure we were getting the real McCoys,and as yet have not run across a bad one. We went out today and found another 17 morels, took them to the neighbors to try. I think when the temps get a little highter they will probably get going. Noticed the mosqitoe are getting worse and the black flies were bad in the trees, came home with two ticks. Probably is a better time to be out in the boat rather than in the bush.
